title: Microsoft closes at record after revealing pricing for new A.I. subscription
description: Microsoft shares rallied to an all-time high after the company announced pricing for its new Microsoft 365 artificial intelligence subscription service.

title: Why 'Oppenheimer' director Christopher Nolan doesn't use a smartphone
description: Nolan revealed that his "kids would probably say I'm a complete Luddite" because of how tech-averse he is in his working life.

title: Meta rolls out first feature update to Threads since launch earlier this month
description: Instagram updated the iOS version of its Threads app, which now includes a follows tab

title: Fervo Energy hits milestone in using oil drilling technology to tap geothermal energy
description: Geothermal company Fervo Energy announced a key milestone in bringing its clean, hot rock energy to the grid at scale.

title: Inter Miami owner expects Lionel Messi signing to double revenues and franchise value over the next year
description: Inter Miami managing owner Jorge Mas expects the arrival of star player Lionel Messi to double franchise revenue and value over the next year.

title: This is one of the best new features coming to your iPhone this fall
description: One of the best new features in iOS 17, StandBy, turns your iPhone into a bedside alarm clock or fun desk companion.

title: Barbie is all the buzz this summer — and retailers hope it will make cautious consumers spend
description: Retailers like Bloomingdale's, Gap and Aldo are looking to leverage the buzz around the Barbie movie to boost sales of discretionary merchandise.

title: Darktrace shares pop 26% after EY concludes report into accounting allegations
description: Darktrace said EY found a "small number of errors and inconsistencies" with some contracts — but nothing that would be "material" to its financial statements.

title: Trump told by special counsel he is criminal target in Jan. 6 probe
description: Special counsel Jack Smith is investigating Donald Trump in connection with efforts to overturn his 2020 election loss to President Joe Biden.

title: United adds Tokyo, Manila and Taipei flights to cater to international travel boom
description: United and its rivals have been beefing up international travel in response to a surge in bookings.

title: Twitter laid off most of its workers in Africa last year. They say they've been ignored and left without severance
description: Former Twitter employees in Ghana have been left without severance and have not heard from the company for three months, sources told CNBC.

title: Soaring temperatures in Europe near record as wildfires rage in Greece and Swiss Alps
description: Researchers say the climate emergency is strongly increasing the odds of heatwaves such as the one currently being experienced across Europe.

title: Bank of America tops analysts’ expectations amid higher interest rates
description: While analysts expected Bank of America to be one of the top beneficiaries of rising interest rates, it hasn't played out that way.

title: U.S. national being held in North Korea after crossing border, UN says
description: The U.S. national crossed the inter-Korean border without authorization, the UN Command disclosed.

title: India is now one of Apple's top 5 iPhone markets for the first time
description: India contributed close to 4% of all iPhone sales for Apple in the second quarter, growing 50% year-on-year, according to Counterpoint Research.

title: Henry Kissinger meets with China's defense minister in Beijing
description: Henry Kissinger, a former U.S. secretary of State, met with China's defense minister, Li Shangfu, in Beijing on Tuesday, the ministry said in a statement.

title: EU's competition chief Margrethe Vestager under fire for hiring a U.S. economist
description: Europe's powerful competition chief is under fire for hiring an American citizen for one of her team's top jobs.

title: British tycoon plans to launch an electric airline that will serve plant-based food
description: Ecojet flights in the U.K. will begin in 2024. Trips to mainland Europe will follow, and long-haul journeys are also in the works.

title: Goldman Sachs cuts odds of a U.S. recession in the next year
description: The investment bank, however, expects some deceleration in subsequent quarters as a result of sequentially slower real disposable personal income growth.

title: Chinese property developer Evergrande posts $81 billion loss over the past two years
description: China Evergrande Group posted a combined loss of $81 billion in its long overdue earnings report late on Monday.

title: China vows to 'restore and expand' consumption to boost growth
description: The announcements follow economic data on Monday that showed China's second quarter growth underwhelmed market expectations.

title: Kerry upholds U.S.-China ‘stability’ in symbolic Beijing visit
description: U.S. special envoy for climate John Kerry emphasized efforts to stabilize U.S.-China relations during his opening remarks at a meeting with Chinese Premier Li Qiang.

title: France and Britain are battling it out for Europe's A.I. crown
description: Two countries are jockeying for position as Europe's capital for artificial intelligence.

title: Most outsourced coders in India will be gone in 2 years due to A.I., Stability AI boss predicts
description: Most outsourced programmers in India will see their jobs wiped out in the next year or two, Stability AI CEO Emad Mostaque said.

title: China's risk of deflation is 'serious' — one economist says it's 'time to act'
description: Some economists are flagging the prospect of deflation in Chin after the steepest decline in prices in June, along with underwhelming second quarter growth.

title: Singapore is facing a wave of political scandals. Here's what we know so far
description: Singapore's ruling People's Action Party has been hit by two resignations, a corruption investigation and public outcry over ministerial conduct.

title: India's reliance on Russian oil may be 'approaching a limit'
description: India's imports of Russian oil has reached a peak for the rest of the year due to infrastructural capacity limitations and curtailed exports from Russia.

title: Can ChatGPT find ‘hidden gems’ in Europe? Yes, if you use these prompts
description: ChatGPT can find off-the-beaten track gems in Europe if you ask the right questions, says the London-based travel writer Lisa Lucas.
